intro: Berkheya ecklonis, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. It produces a single, showy flower head that blooms in spring and summer. Berkheya ecklonis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
